section.title: Building from Source
section.p: There are two parts to Simal, an Apache Forrest generated Catalogue site and an Apache Wicket web application. For now the web application can be ignored by the average user since it does not do anything particularly useful. If you want to work on it then join our mailing lists.

To work with the catalogue you will need to checkout an build Apache Forrest 0.8-dev (that is Forrest's current SVN head). The Forrest project has some excellent documentation for this (it's easy, honest).

section.title: Running the Catalogue Application
section.p: Once you have Forrest installed change to your Simal directory and run the command forrest run. Now point your browser at http:localhost:8089 - that's it.
section.note: We use a different port to the default Forrest port.
section.p: You are now running the catalogue in dynamic mode. You can edit content files (stored in src/documentation/content/xdcos) and then refresh your browser to see the changes immediately. It's worth noting that this version of the catalogue also includes all the project documentation. So you can help us improve the documentation by running the catalogue and editing the files whilst you experiment. Use the Contributor tab above to be taken to the contributor section where you will find more information on how to help Simal improve.

section.title: Static Content Generation
section.p: It is possible to generate the catalogue as a static snapshot suitable for hosting on a normal web server or distributing via CD or other such means. To do this simply run the command forrest site.

section.title: Current Status
section.p: To view the current catalogue functionality follow the links in the catalogue menu on the left of the above linked page. For more information about the current status and recent changes in the catalogue code see the recent changes document.

section.title: What Needs to be Done
section.p: In the contributor section of the catalogue site (see the "Contributor" tab above) you will find a "To Do" menu item this will give an indication of some of the tasks that we need to tackle. However, if you want to contribute in some other way, please feel free to make proposals on our mailing list.

section.title: Getting Help/Providing Feedback
section.p: We do not have a permanent home for this project yet. So the OSS Watch list is our mailing list for now. We are still deciding where it should live permanently - suggestions welcome.

section.title: Open Source?
section.p: Whilst this will be an open source project it is not one at this time because we have not addressed the IPR and licensing issues, nor have we started to think about what licence is most appropriate.

Therefore, if you do contribute to the project in any way it is assumed that you do so under your contract with Oxford University and therefore Oxford University owns the copyright to those contributions. If you are not an employee of Oxford university then I am afraid we are unable to accept your contributions at this time. We will resolve this very soon before the project goes public.
